title: Liberia: Mittal Steel Go Slow - Mine Workers Furious Over Bonus Cut
text:
Nigeria: Airforce Bombards Boko Haram Bunkers 
"Management has change the whole issue of shift bonus and allowances by giving to certain section and leaving out the others that's why these workers are angry," the source added. For now, the mine workers are leading the go-slow in Yekepa and the labor unrest may spill over to Grand Bassa County where many rail workers are based. 
The steel giant has come under criticism this 2015 after slicing more than 200 jobs due to what the company called unfavorable market condition. There were reservations by the workers union before and after the redundancy but there have been calmness so far since the job cuts. Liberia
